description._content: Returns a list of your photos which haven't been geo-tagged.

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: max_upload_date
argument._content: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

argument.name: min_taken_date
argument._content: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

argument.name: max_taken_date
argument._content: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

argument.name: privacy_filter
argument._content:
Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. Valid values are:
  • 1 public photos
  • 2 private photos visible to friends
  • 3 private photos visible to family
  • 4 private photos visible to friends & family
  • 5 completely private photos

argument.name: sort
argument._content: The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc. The possible values are: date-posted-asc, date-posted-desc, date-taken-asc, date-taken-desc, interestingness-desc, and interestingness-asc.

argument.name: media
argument._content: Filter results by media type. Possible values are all (default), photos or videos

argument.name: min_upload_date
argument._content: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

argument.name: extras
argument._content: A comma-delimited list of extra information to fetch for each returned record. Currently supported fields are: description, license, date_upload, date_taken, owner_name, icon_server, original_format, last_update, geo, tags, machine_tags, o_dims, views, media, path_alias, url_sq, url_t, url_s, url_q, url_m, url_n, url_z, url_c, url_l, url_o

argument.name: per_page
argument._content: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

argument.name: page
argument._content: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

error._content: SSL is required to access the Flickr API.
The call required signing but no signature was sent.
The login details or auth token passed were invalid.

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
error._content: The method requires user authentication but the user was not logged in, or the authenticated method call did not have the required permissions.
The API key passed was not valid or has expired.
The requested service is temporarily unavailable.
The requested operation failed due to a temporary issue.
The requested response format was not found.
The requested method was not found.
The SOAP envelope send in the request could not be parsed.
The XML-RPC request document could not be parsed.
One or more arguments contained a URL that has been used for abuse on Flickr.
